title: Learner-Centered Language Learning Strategies for Corporate Capacity Development

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: A course emphasizing immediately applicable language competency development. Combines real-time collaboration and self-directed learning via digital platforms

learning_goals: Learners can utilize specialized terminology and expressions required in workplace contexts with 80% accuracy
Peer review based on learner feedback improves business document writing skills by 30%
Using a mobile Learning Management System (LMS), learners can develop and execute self-directed language learning plans exceeding 5 hours per week

Learners select three or more non-verbal communication strategies (eye contact, gestures, screen sharing) in real-time video collaboration tools like Zoom or Microsoft Teams, and achieve effective communication evaluations from over 80% of participants based on given scenarios (meeting facilitation, presentations, discussions)
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
